contentHtml: #81. What is the output? function sayHi(name) { return `Hi there, ${name}`; } console.log(sayHi()); javascript A: Hi there, B: Hi there, undefined C: Hi there, null D: ReferenceError Đáp án Answer: B By default, arguments have the value of undefined, unless a value has been passed to the function. In this case, we didn't pass a value for the name argument. name is equal to undefined which gets logged. In ES6, we can overwrite this default undefined
